articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Thursday lashed out at his political opponents as "anti-state forces", said North Korea has hacked the country's elections and defended his short-lived martial law order as a legal move to protect democracy.
articles.title: South Korean President Yoon vows to 'fight to the end'

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Timour Azhari
articles.description: Refugees from Syria's long civil war were making their way home on Wednesday, as a new interim prime minister said he had been appointed with the backing of the rebels who toppled President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Refugees return to Syria as caretaker prime minister appointed

articles.author: Joseph Ax, Rich McKay, Brad Brooks
articles.description: In the days since Luigi Mangione was charged with murder for gunning down a top health insurance executive, more than a thousand donations have poured into an online fundraiser for his legal defense, with messages supporting him and even celebrating the crime.
articles.title: Luigi Mangione was charged with murder - then donations started pouring in

articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israelis and Palestinians are signaling new efforts to forge a ceasefire deal, even a limited one, for the first time in a year that would pause the fighting in Gaza and return to Israel some of the hostages still held in the Palestinian enclave.
articles.title: Israel, Palestinians explore Gaza truce with US envoy on Mideast shuttle mission

articles.author: Gerry Doyle
articles.description: Chinese strikes on airfields will stymie U.S. military aircraft in the Indo-Pacific region if there is a conflict, a new study says, recommending that the United States invest in cheap, uncrewed aircraft and runway repair capabilities.
articles.title: US military airfields in Indo-Pacific too easily taken out of action, report says

articles.author: Michael Martina, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: Two senior members of Taiwan's government are in the United States to meet people connected to President-elect Donald Trump's transition team, five sources told Reuters, in an effort by Taiwan to establish ties with the incoming administration.
articles.title: Taiwan officials visit US for quiet talks with Trump's circle, say sources

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Maya Gebeily, Tom Perry
articles.description: Rebel leader Ahmad al-Sharaa's Islamist group is stamping its authority on Syria's state with the same lightning speed that it seized the country, deploying police, installing an interim government and meeting foreign envoys - raising concerns over how inclusive Damascus' new rulers intend to be.
articles.title: Syrian rebel leader, after Assad's ouster, puts his own stamp on the state

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin told Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz in a call that it was important for the United States and Israel to be in close consultation over events unfolding in Syria, the Pentagon said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Pentagon chief urges 'close consultation' between Israel and US on Syria

articles.author: Daniel Cole
articles.description: Aided by favorable winds and weather, firefighters on Wednesday progressed in containing a wildfire in the beach community of Malibu, California, where 6,300 people evacuated their homes as schools and businesses shut their doors.
articles.title: Malibu wildfire destroys homes, forces 6,300 people to evacuate

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has invited Chinese President Xi Jinping to attend his inauguration next month, CBS News reported on Wednesday, citing multiple sources.
articles.title: Trump invites China's Xi Jinping to attend inauguration, CBS News reports
